CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1 (length);Remainder inadmissible;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant was placed in police custody on charges of robbery , and informed that an investigation had been opened against him by the prosecutor attached to ORG . On DATE , the prosecutor committed the applicant for trial before ORG .

CARDINAL . ORG acquitted the applicant in a judgment of DATE , upheld , on DATE , by ORG . However , in a final decision of DATE , ORG reversed the judgment , convicted the applicant and sentenced him to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment . He was detained from DATE to CARDINAL DATE and again from DATE to DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE , the ORG , following the applicant ’s request , lodged an extraordinary appeal with ORG to have the final decision of DATE quashed ( “ recurs în anulare ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG allowed the extraordinary appeal . It quashed the final decision of DATE , the decision of CARDINAL DATE and the judgment of DATE and sent the case back to the prosecutor to continue the investigations . It held that the evidence adduced in the case was contradictory and needed further clarification before the case could be tried by the courts .

CARDINAL . In a decision of DATE , the prosecutor attached to ORG closed the criminal investigations against the applicant . On DATE , the same prosecutor informed the applicant that he had reversed his previous decision and reopened the criminal investigations in the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor again committed the applicant for trial before ORG , which acquitted the applicant in a judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . The prosecutor attached to ORG appealed against this judgment to ORG , where the case is still pending DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP In a judgment of DATE , ORG dismissed as premature a civil action lodged by the applicant against the ORG through its ORG , seeking damages for his arrest , which he judged to have been illegal . It appears from the file that the applicant did not appeal against this judgment .
